page.title: 10St.Dunstan's House,Calne.
page.content: There is a school and an old people's home both called St.Dunstan, in honour of that man.He was born in 909 A.D.and was a member of King Edward's court.Later he became a priest,and in 943 the King commissioned him to restore monastic life at Glastonbury.He refounded many ancient abbeys,and was a principal adviser to the Wessex kings.Eventually he was made Abbot of Glastonbury. In 960 Dunstan became Archbishop of Canterbury.The present Coronation Rite was compiled by him.He was also a metal worker and bell founder,a scribe and draughtsman,and he played the harp.In 978 Dunstan sat with the WITAN <Council>at Calne.The floor of the council chamber fell,and Dunstan was the only uninjured survivor.He died in 988.
